item.title: Artificial Potential Field Collision Avoidance for holonomic mobile robots
item.description: Contributors: Balakumar Sundaralingam, Rohith Prasad. Introduction The use of tele-operated robots in search and rescue, environment monitoring and interstellar exploration has increased in the past years. Tele-operation of robots is a complex task. The operator not only has to focus on the task but also perform collision avoidance so that the robot does not collide with obstacles in the environment. The addition of an automatic collision avoidance system to the robot will ease the operator and allow the operator to focus more on the task.
